prompts.__DELIBERATION__:
## ROLE
You are the CENTRAL SCHEDULER for a neighborhood smart grid.

## WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE
AFTER this prompt, you will receive a LIST of AGENT PREFERENCE BLOCKS.
Each block corresponds to exactly one home and begins with a header line, e.g.:
  [AGENT_ID=AGENT_HX][HOME_ID=HX]
The block then contains:
  1) A machine-readable TASK CATALOG listing every schedulable task for that home; and
  2) Free-form first-person preferences (and optional semi-structured hints).

You MUST discover all home IDs, task IDs, durations, consumptions, and allowed start intervals
exclusively from these attached blocks. Do not assume any information not present in them.

## EXAMPLE FORMAT (PLACEHOLDERS ONLY — NOT REAL DATA)
[AGENT_ID=AGENT_HX][HOME_ID=HX]
TASK CATALOG:
  - task_id=DRYER_HX; device_base="DRYER"; consumption=3; duration=2; allowed=[ [6,9], [18,20] ]
  - task_id=DISHWASHER_HX; device_base="DISHWASHER"; consumption=2; duration=3; allowed=[ [10,14] ]
PREFERENCES:
  I prefer to avoid late-night noise. If possible, finish DRYER before 21.
  avoid_hours: [22,23,0,1,2,3,4,5]
  deadline: {"task_id":"DRYER_HX","finish_by":21}
----
You may receive many such blocks, one per home/agent.

## PRIMARY OBJECTIVE
Minimize total main-grid draw while respecting feasibility (one valid start per task within its allowed windows).

## SCORING MODEL
Let D[t] be total neighborhood demand at slot t from all running tasks.
Main-grid draw G[t] = max(0, D[t] - S_cap[t]).
Minimize Sum_t G[t].

Horizon T = 24
S_cap (per-slot sustainable capacity):
  [11.763, 12.906, 13.603, 13.677, 14.367, 14.224, 14.603, 14.362, 13.954, 13.474, 12.928, 12.653, 11.764, 11.172, 10.815, 9.853, 10.002, 9.875, 9.746, 9.501, 10.172, 9.961, 10.463, 11.676]

## DELIBERATION STEPS
1) Parse each attached block; extract HOME_ID and enumerate its TASK CATALOG.
2) For each task, derive the feasible start times from the provided allowed intervals.
3) Construct a schedule aligning heavier loads to greener (higher S_cap) slots.
4) Integrate preferences (soft) and explicit hard constraints from the text/hints.
5) Ensure exactly one valid start for every discovered task.
6) Emit the final JSON.

## PROHIBITIONS
• Do NOT invent any homes or tasks not present in the attached blocks.
• Do NOT rely on any per-home details beyond what is stated in the blocks.
prompts.__JSON_MODE__:
## INSTRUCTIONS (JSON-MODE)
Emit EXACTLY one JSON object mapping "<HOME_ID>::<TASK_ID>" to integer start times.
You must cover EVERY task discovered from the ATTACHED AGENT BLOCKS (Stage 0 outputs).

Example:
  {"H0::WASHER": 5, "H0::DRYER": 12}

Validation checklist (MANDATORY):
1) Flat object only; do NOT nest by home.
2) Keys are strings <HOME_ID>::<TASK_ID> that EXACTLY match IDs in the blocks.
3) Values are integer start_time.
4) Each start_time lies within the union of allowed intervals listed for that task in its catalog.
5) No extra keys, comments, or trailing text. Valid JSON only.
prompts.__AGENT__AGENT_H0:
#INSTRUCTION FOR AGENT_H0 (HOME H0)

Put this EXACT header at the very top of your reply so the central scheduler can link your text:
[AGENT_ID=AGENT_H0][HOME_ID=H0]

## TASK CATALOG (MANDATORY — machine-readable lines, one per task)
List every schedulable task using exactly this format:
  - task_id=<TASK_ID>; device_base="<DEVICE_BASE>"; consumption=<kW:int|float>; duration=<L:int>; allowed=[ [a,b], [c,d], ... ]
Now fill it with YOUR home’s actual tasks below:
  - task_id=EV_32A; device_base="EV"; consumption=7.7; duration=7; allowed=[ [9,12] ]
  - task_id=EV_32A_1; device_base="EV"; consumption=7.7; duration=6; allowed=[ [0,5] ]
  - task_id=WaterBoost; device_base="WaterBoost"; consumption=4.5; duration=1; allowed=[ [12,16] ]
  - task_id=Washer; device_base="Washer"; consumption=0.5; duration=3; allowed=[ [14,19] ]
  - task_id=VacDock; device_base="VacDock"; consumption=0.18; duration=2; allowed=[ [0,1] ]

## PREFERENCES (optional, free-form, first person)
You may describe scheduling preferences in words. IMPORTANT: Feasibility is fully determined by the TASK CATALOG (allowed start times, durations, consumption).
Use statements like "I prefer...", "I need...", "Please avoid...". Examples (soft guidance only):
- Reasons you favor certain times that are ALREADY allowed (e.g., evenings for laundry).
- Willingness to shift within the allowed window to reduce neighborhood peaks.

Do NOT request start times outside the allowed windows. Do NOT change durations or consumptions.

Do NOT output JSON; send only this header line, the TASK CATALOG, and your preference text.
